children.text: Stanley Kubrick was notoriously private and rarely gave interviews. I selected this interview due to Jeremy Bernstein’s skill in drawing Kubrick out on diverse aspects of his life and work, as well as its timing. Conducted in 1965, shortly after
(1964) and three years before the release of his seminal film
(1968), it captures a pivotal moment in his career.
For those interested in learning more about Kubrick,
, edited by Gene D. Phillips, is an essential resource.

citation: Kubrick, Stanley, and Jeremy Bernstein. “Stanley Kubrick Interview with Jeremy Bernstein, November 27, 1965.” Audio recording, 76 minutes.
label: Stanley Kubrick Interview with Jeremy Bernstein (1965)
